page.title: 16Religious life
page.content: {St.Andrew's Church,}Miserden is the centre of the religious life of Miserden parish numbering about 400 people. It is one of the four parishes in a{United Benefice of Oakridge, {Bisley,Miserden and Edgeworth. Services are Mattins on the first Sunday of the month and the Parish Communion at 11 a.m on Sunday mornings. Funerals,Weddings and Baptisms are by arrangement. The Church is under the care of two Churchwardens and the Parochial Church Council who are elected annually. The Church is involved in various activities arranged by the{Diocese of {Gloucester.}These include Youth Conferences,Deanery and Diocesan Synods and many other events. {The Church has served the community {of Miserden from Saxon times.
